alert.note: Alert for Panola; Quitman; Tate; Tunica (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 5:02PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Tunica, southwestern Tate, northeastern Quitman and northwestern Panola Counties through 530 PM CDT... At 501 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Crenshaw, or 15 miles southwest of Senatobia, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Senatobia, Como, Crenshaw, Sledge, Pleasant Grove, Falcon, Askew, Gerlach Mill, Buxton, McGhee, Longtown, Tibbs, Sarah, Horatio, Cypress Corner and Bluff. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for northwestern Mississippi.
